data.title: #6012 avoid a surprise by keep notice of a change
data.body:
Newly joined client is now informed of lobby info and every client
present in lobby is informed of changes made by admin.

data.title: #6012 avoid a surprise by keep notice of a change
Beacons should be shown ontop of shroud
data.body:
![beaconbuga](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7704140/3742664/22bc135e-176c-11e4-987d-29dc14eabf9f.png)
![beaconbugb](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7704140/3742668/23bff536-176c-11e4-9037-e6c08855ae7f.png)
There is no beacon shown, when you place a supportpower ontop of shroud.

data.title: Fixes Maps not being able to force tech levels
data.body: Fixes #6104

data.title: Bug with Maps forcing tech levels
data.body:
There is a bug that if you override the tech level in the map.yaml it doesnt acctually override it.
This is because in line 43 in the ProvidesTechPrerequisite class it only looks in the Global settings and not the map settings.

`this.enabled = info.Name == init.world.LobbyInfo.GlobalSettings.TechLevel;`

data.title: Add a production handicap option
data.body:
Currently games between players of different skill levels are generally short and unenjoyable. Having a +/- multiplier option for production in the lobby would allow a wider range of skill levels to play together, and allow challenges such as four humans versus a single 400% production AI.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/3383662-add-a-production-handicap-option?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: send player names to master server
Mono 3.6.1 compiler errors.
data.body:
Fails to build with complaints that some IObservableCollection members are not used.
Fixed [here](https://github.com/Phrohdoh/OpenRA/commit/7d7293eab8b3fb7ae7e74d936bf1e4226e9b559e) but not properly.

data.title: Adds ability to define tile sub-cells in mod.yaml
data.body: Implements #6086 - Number and offsets of SubCells should not be hardcoded.

data.title: RA - Capturable Tank Tech
data.body:
Allied units are buildable if player is allied and captures soviet  war fac. and don't have allied one allied units are buildable.

Sorry for no screenshot.

<bountysource-plugin>

---

Want to back this issue? **[Place a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/3381263-ra-capturable-tank-tech?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Fix unit selection hotkeys for players.
data.body:
This also explicitly disables them for spectators, like we already do for control groups.

Fixes #5753.

data.title: Edge of map shroud rendering is broken
data.body: The map-edge shroud tiles are not rendered during normal gameplay, giving a hard map border.  Regression from #5851.

data.title: Request: C&C Covert Operations missions
data.body:
I am not sure if the C&C Covert Ops expansion missions were added yet or is it WIP?

 GDI Missions
- Blackout
- Hell's Fury
- Infiltrated!
- Elemental Imperative
- Ground Zero
- Twist of Fate
- Blindsided

Nod Missions
- Bad Neighborhood
- Deceit
- Eviction Notice
- The Tiberium Strain
- Cloak and Dagger
- Hostile Takeover
- Under Siege:  C&C
- Nod Death Squad

Also there are several dino missions too.

data.title: Prevent MAD tanks executing multiple StartDetonationSequence activities
data.body:
Results in a bunch of E1 ejecting out if you spam deploy on the MAD.

Thanks to TerrorJaap for reporting this, with an [accompanied replay](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RhlWEvzfKH4&feature=youtu.be).

data.title: Requesting Feedback on Refactoring Subcells
data.body:
I'm working on refactoring the sub-cell code.
Current plan:
- [x] Implement #6086 (see YAML) (PR #6100)
- [x] Expose subcells more in the API
- [ ] Fix UnloadCargo 
- [ ] Use exposure of subcells in API 
- [ ] Split influence (occupied space) to have a `toPos` and `fromPos` to account for movement
- [ ] Use `toPos` and `fromPos` to identify actors moving from the same cell to keep them together
- [ ] Don't know yet - figure that out

mod.yaml:

``` YAML

SubCells:
    # Sub-cell center offset pairs (x, y) from the center of the cell
    Offsets: 0,0, -299,-256, 256,-256, 0,0, -299,256, 256,256

    # Index of default sub-cell
    Default: 3
```

data.title: Add WavSoundLength to show track length in music player
data.body: Adds WavSoundLength to WavLoader, adapts MusicInfo to use length function depending on extension.

data.title: Remove a spot harvesters had trouble accessing in Sea & Cake map
data.body:
Fixes #5939

Made that corner two cells wide. The behaviour could be seen every time without this change, with it I can't reproduce it anymore.
![screenshot from 2014-07-27 15 46 28](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4331210/3714111/b556dec0-1595-11e4-938a-dc3e761920a0.png)

data.title: Add plane repulsion
data.body:
This adds the long-overdue repulsion for planes which adds polish and addresses some gameplay issues.
There's supposedly an issue with repulsion which can throw aircraft heading to land, but I haven't noticed this in my testing. If someone can repro it I can look at addressing it in this patch.

data.title: Number and offsets of SubCells should not be hardcoded
data.body:
TS infantry is quite large relative to cell size so Westwood reduced infantry subcells to 3, removing the two bottom ones.

In OpenRA's TS mod the two bottom subcells are outside the tile, to fix that (and increase moddability) we should make these customizable.

data.title: Fix AI not repairing buildings if struck by support powers.
data.body:
AI wasn't initiating repairs when struck by support powers.

Fixed by moving the "Is the attacker still alive" checks to after the initiate repairs code.

data.title: Improve actor preview rendering
data.body:
This introduces an `IActorPreview` interface and `ActorPreviewInitializer` class, and wires them up for our existing render traits and PlaceBuildingOrderGenerator.

Specifically, this adds support for:
- Mixed voxels and sprites in building previews (e.g. the TS laser turret).
- Previews built from multiple sprites, which fixes building previews for TS and the D2K turret.
- Correct initial facings for base defence turrets.
- Animated building previews (spinning radars, blinking light, etc).

This will also become a key part of the ingame map editor, and can be used to create ingame modding tools such as a sequence previewer or weapon/turret offset calculator.

The best way to test this right now is to disable the tile footprint previews in the PlaceBuildingOrderGenerator.  A later pr will change PBOG to render valid tiles below the preview, and render wall previews consistently with regular structures.

data.title: Will fix actor stacking bug - UnloadCargo and Cargo.SpawnPassengers
data.body:
Requires improvements to sub-cell logic. (I'm working on it.)
Supersedes #6060 and #6063
Fixes UnloadCargo and Cargo.SpawnPassengers by queuing a slightly smarter nudge w/ others that
have the same CenterPosition.

data.title: New shortcut: CTRL+rClick -> instant cancel unit that is being built
data.body:
I really hate the slowness of canceling some unit from building; first it makes it on hold, and then after 10 clicks (because game lags), it will finally cancel it.

It would be super awesome if there was shortcut to insta-cancel anything.

So if you CTRL+rightclick, it would CANCEL the unit (you get money back from whatever was used for it before). Not just remove 1 from queue like the current cancel behaviour acts now; in current way its really hard to cancel something if you have 100 on queue.

data.title: Surrender does nothing if mission already completed
data.body: Possibly disable the button if the game state is at a completed mission.
